title: Termination at Infosys Mysuru Campus, 45 Receive Firing Mails with 'Alternative Path' Suggestions
text:
Updated March 27th 2025, 15:58 IST
Termination at Infosys Mysuru Campus, 45 Receive Firing Mails with 'Alternative Path' Suggestions
Infosys has terminated approximately 30 to 45 trainees from its Mysuru campus on March 26 after they failed to pass internal assessments.
India News- 1 min read
Srujani Mohinta
Bengaluru: Software giant Infosys has terminated approximately 30 to 45 trainees from its Mysuru campus on March 26 after they failed to pass internal assessments.
However, the company has offered alternative career paths to the affected trainees, including a 12-week training program for potential roles in Infosys Business Process Management (BPM).
According to reports, Infosys is also providing a one-month ex-gratia payment along with a relieving letter to all impacted trainees.
For those who do not wish to opt for the BPM course, the Bengaluru-based company has offered to fund additional training to help them explore other career opportunities.
(This is a developing story.)
